newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan says third man jumps aboard patrol boats.
newsitem.headline: Japan says third man jumps aboard patrol boats.

text.p: An activist on a Taiwanese fishing boat challenging Japan's claim to islands in the East China Sea jumped from his ship on to a Japanese coastguard boat on Monday, a coastguard spokesman said.
The spokesman told Reuters the incident was separate from an earlier boarding in which two demonstrators jumped from a Hong Kong protest ship on to another Japanese coastguard vessel.

In the first incident, the two activists jumped from a boat called the "Protect-the-Diaoyus", flagship of a Taiwan-Hong Kong flotilla challenging Japan's claim to an island chain called the Senkakus in Japanese and the Diaoyus in Chinese.
The coastguard has mobilised about 60 patrol boats to prevent the flotilla from approaching the disputed island chain.
"In the latest incident, a man jumped on to one of our coastguard ships from a Taiwanese fishing boat," the spokesman said.
The coastguard spokesman said Japanese authorities had not arrested the three men and wanted to return them to their ships.
